data.author: Deepika Bhatt
data.content: The director of the Oscar-winning short documentary 'The Elephant Whisperers', Kartiki Gonsalves, was felicitated with a cash reward of ₹1 crore by Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin in Chennai on Tuesday. Gonsalves dedicated her win to the state, women, conservation and indigenous communities. The CM had earlier met Bomman and Bellie, who played lead roles in the documentary.
data.title: Oscar-winning director Kartiki gets ₹1 cr cash prize from TN govt

data.author: Apaar Sharma
data.content: A 17-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh has died by suicide after the police allegedly failed to take action against her stalkers who molested her multiple times, officials said. "I hope they will be arrested after my death," she wrote. Police arrested two of the three people named in the FIR based on the complaint lodged by her father on Monday.
data.title: 17-year-old UP girl dies by suicide, writes 'I hope molesters will be arrested after my death'

data.author: Nakul Ahuja
data.content: Places of religious tourism earned ₹1,34,543 crore in 2022, up from ₹65,070 crore in 2021, data released by the Ministry of Tourism said. A revenue of ₹1,94,881 crore was generated in 2018, while places of religious tourism earned revenue of ₹2,11,661 crore in 2019. Only revenue of ₹50,136 crore was generated in 2020 because of the COVID-19 pandemic.
data.title: Places of religious tourism earned ₹1,34,543 cr in 2022: Govt data

data.author: Ankush Verma
data.content: Pakistan government will charge PKR100 per litre more from the rich for fuel so that poor people can be given a subsidy of PKR100 per litre, Minister of State for Petroleum Musadik Masood Malik said. The scheme will be finalised in six weeks for which all the analysis has been completed by the relevant authorities, Malik added.
data.title: Rich to be charged PKR100 per litre more for fuel in Pakistan

data.author: Amartya Sharma
data.content: Actress Shefali Shah revealed she never "aspired" to be an actress. "I had contemplated becoming a neurosurgeon or a stewardess, a dancer or even a singer...but acting, it was beyond the horizon," she added. Shefali stated she comes from a family that's not avid film lover. "But there were specific movies we made sure we watched in theatres," she said.
data.title: Didn't want to be actress, wanted to become neurosurgeon: Shefali

data.author: Udit Gupta
data.content: Anupam Kher took to Instagram and penned a note for his friend, late actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik. He shared a video of him showering rose petals on Satish's picture and wrote, "Go, I forgive you for leaving me alone." "I will surely find you in people's laughter! But will miss our friendship on a day-to-day basis," Anupam added.
data.title: I forgive you for leaving me alone: Anupam pens note for Satish

data.author: Disha Jana
data.content: Indonesia may terminate the visa-on-arrival facility for Russians and Ukrainians owing to an alleged increase in crimes being reported there. The law violations committed by citizens of Russia and Ukraine include overstaying their visas and working illegally as hairstylists, tour guides and taxi drivers. Indonesia experienced a surge in tourism from both of those countries since the Ukraine war.
data.title: Indonesia may terminate visa-on-arrival for Russians & Ukrainians

data.author: Ankur Taliyan
data.content: Former India head coach Anil Kumble, during a discussion on JioCinema, named batter Mayank Agarwal and spinner Yuzvendra Chahal as the most underrated batsman and bowler respectively in the Indian Premier League. "Chahal has changed the fortunes of whichever team he has played for," added Kumble. Notably, Mayank was bought by SRH in IPL 2023 auction.
data.title: Chahal has changed fortunes of teams he has played for: Kumble

data.author: Mansi Agarwal
data.content: Samsung's mobile business head TM Roh has said that the company is "closely working" with Microsoft, Google and other partners to develop generative AI technologies. "Going forward AI technology will play an important role to advance the smartphone industry," he stated. Roh made the remarks during his visit to Samsung India's R&D facility in Bengaluru.
data.title: Samsung working with Microsoft, Google on generative AI: Exec

data.author: Ananya Goyal
data.content: Average salaries in India are expected to increase by 10.2% in 2023, slightly lower than the actual increase of 10.4% in FY22, as per EY Future of Pay 2023 report. The report said the e-commerce sector will see the highest salary growth (12.5%), followed by professional services (11.9%). Blue-collar workers are expected to receive a slightly larger decrease in compensation.
data.title: India to see average salary hikes of 10.2% in 2023: EY report

data.author: Shalini Ojha
data.content: PM Narendra Modi will visit poll-bound Karnataka on March 25, marking his seventh visit to the state this year. He will land at HAL Airport in Bengaluru, fly to Chikkaballapur for the inauguration of Madhusudan Sai Institute of Medical Sciences and Research, return to Bengaluru and inaugurate the Whitefield Metro line, an official press release said.
data.title: PM to visit poll-bound K'taka for 7th time this year on March 25

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Speaking during News18-India Chaupal, Aam Aadmi Party chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said the party shouldn't be called another version of Congress as it seems like an "abuse". A video has been shared by News18 wherein Kejriwal can be seen replying to a journalist's question and saying, "I don't want to be Congress…mujhe gaali mat do (don't abuse me)."
data.title: Don't abuse me: Arvind Kejriwal on being called Congress' version

data.author: Ria Kapoor
data.content: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has said that he wants to congratulate Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann for maintaining the law and order situation in a patient and mature way. "In the last one year, the Punjab government has shown that if the intentions are right, then law and order can be maintained very well," he added.
data.title: I congratulate Mann for maintaining Punjab law & order: Kejriwal

data.author: Ayushi Jain
data.content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal has said that the presentation of the Delhi government's Budget cannot be stopped like a "car by a traffic light". "An elected government can't be treated like this", he tweeted. This came after CM Arvind Kejriwal alleged that the Central Government stopped the budget presentation, which was scheduled to be held on March 21.
data.title: Delhi Budget can't be stopped like a car by traffic light: Sibal

data.author: Anisha Joneja
data.content: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said unless the Opposition is ideologically aligned, BJP can't be defeated and added there needs to be a "coalition of ideologies to fight the Hindutva ideology". Kishor also said to challenge BJP, parties need to understand its strengths of "Hindutva, nationalism and welfarism". "If you can't breach...two of these...then you can't challenge BJP," he added.
data.title: Oppn needs 'ideological alignment' to defeat BJP: Prashant Kishor

data.author: Swati Dubey
data.content: A report by Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) stated that global warming is expected to breach the critical threshold by 2030 as the world isn't doing enough to prevent rising temperatures. Despite there being various feasible solutions to curb global warming, temperatures have risen by 1.1°C above pre-industrial levels and are likely to surpass 1.5°C in future, it added.
data.title: Global warming will breach critical threshold by 2030: IPCC report

data.author: Nidhi Sinha
data.content: Two Noida residents were arrested for killing their married sister and dumping her body in Hindon river. Days after dumping Nazma's body, Sartaj and Shahrukh approached police, saying their sister was missing. They confessed to the crime after post-mortem revealed that Nazma died of strangulation. Police said the brothers were upset about Nazma's alleged drinking habit and illicit relationships.
data.title: Noida men kill their married sister, throw body in Hindon river

data.author: Ria Kapoor
data.content: An Uttar Pradesh government teacher died by suicide after alleged harassment by her husband and in-laws. The incident took place on Friday. The deceased woman's family members alleged that her husband and in-laws demanded ₹5 lakh dowry and used to harass her regularly. Five people have been booked in connection with the incident.
data.title: UP woman kills self after alleged harassment by husband, in-laws

data.author: Ayushi Jain
data.content: Hawkers assaulted two employees of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) while they were carrying out an anti-encroachment drive in Warje Malwadi on Sunday, the civic body said in its complaint. When the staff picked up the hawkers' stuff, they argued and hit the employees with "bamboo sticks", PMC's Madhav Jagtap stated. Following this, four hawkers were arrested, Hindustan Times reported.
data.title: Hawkers assault PMC staff during anti-encroachment drive in Pune

data.author: Ayushi Jain
data.content: A fire broke out at a power substation of Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) in Mumbai's Wadala on Monday, following which at least four fire tenders were rushed to the spot. The cause of the blaze, which erupted at around 9:30 pm in Sangam Nagar, was not immediately known. No casualties were reported, a civic official said.
data.title: Fire breaks out at BEST's power substation in Mumbai's Wadala

data.author: Saurabh Sinha
data.content: A police constable saved a woman from drowning after he saw her jump into the Godavari river in a suicide attempt. A video of the incident has gone viral. Constable Angani Veerababu jumped into the river and handed the woman over to her parents. Veerababu was felicitated for this act by Andhra Pradesh DGP with a cash reward.
data.title: Policeman saves woman drowning in river in Andhra, video viral

data.author: Ayushi Jain
data.content: Three persons have been arrested for vandalising a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus and a car in Pune's Bavdhan on Sunday, officials said. The accused, who were under the influence of alcohol, obstructed the bus' path, pelted stones at its windows and hit the driver, as per the complaint. They reportedly intended to create panic in the area.
data.title: 3 drunk men pelt stones at PMPML bus in Pune, arrested

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Over 55 cars, including some rare supercars produced between 1970 and early 2000s, participated in the second edition of Modern Classic Rally organised in Mumbai. The participating cars were driven in formation from BKC to Worli Sea Face and back. Some of the iconic cars that participated in the rally were Mustang Mach 1, Aston Martin DBS and Jaguar E-type.
data.title: Over 55 cars participate in Modern Classic Rally in Mumbai

data.author: Disha Jana
data.content: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan has requested the country's chief justice to allow him to join court proceedings through video conferencing. "A death trap was laid out at the [court premises in] Islamabad on Saturday...where I had to attend a hearing in the Toshakhana...case," he said. Notably, Khan has also urged the chief justice to club the cases lodged against him.
data.title: Death trap laid: Imran Khan on seeking virtual hearings in court

data.author: Anisha Joneja
data.content: Ratings agency Moody's has affirmed the ratings of Switzerland's biggest bank UBS and downgraded outlooks on its long term deposit and senior unsecured ratings to 'negative' from 'stable'. On Monday, the Swiss authorities announced that UBS will acquire 167-year-old Credit Suisse in a rescue deal. After the acquisition, UBS said it plans to downsize Credit Suisse's investment banking business.
data.title: Moody's changes UBS' outlook to 'negative' from 'stable'
